website_summaries.verdict: A budget traction pad set that's perfect for smaller vehicles and tires.
pros: Traction mats have a smaller, narrower profile for storing in smaller vehicle trunks and cargo spaces
Built-in traction teeth grip slippery snow and mud better than tires alone
cons: The smaller size of the traction pad may not be adequate for larger truck and SUV tires

customer_reviews.title: I don't know if they're the best of the kind for the money
customer_reviews.text: Second pair in about 8 years or so. First got used at least a half dozen times getting me and people I was around out of stuck places in both snow and mud before I gave them to a family member and bought the second. So far as I know, the first pair is a bit beat up but still serviceable. I don't know if they're the best of the kind for the money, but I've got nothing to complain about and they've done their job.
customer_reviews.author: Realon

customer_reviews.title: I’m so glad I bought these... bailed me out of a surprise sticky mess
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase for those just in case and oh crap moments. Finally needed these over a year after I bought them. These saved me from having to pay for an offroad recovery when I wasn’t really out to offroad but got stuck during a quick diversion from a main road. Got them cleaned up and back in the Jeep for next time (although I’d prefer not to need them!). They did not get damaged during use. Very happy. Vehicle is a 4x4 Jeep Patriot.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ochoa

customer_reviews.title: Place, Rev, Dodge the Bullet!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried mine on muddy surfaces, sandy surfaces, and snowy surfaces and the three things in common are they don't help, they're a waste of money, and they're some scary projectiles when the tire is done playing with them and rip them off the surface and into space! Either get better tires, a 4x4 or sign up for a tow service.
customer_reviews.author: Majkboy

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE for anyone who owns a car. Saved my sisters Life!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my sister, she lives in the mountains of North Carolina, she said these literally saved her life one night when she was stuck in the snow on a back road by herself with no cellphone reception... Great gift for anyone who drives virtually anywhere... especially snow or mud or sand.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth V.

customer_reviews.title: Worthless trash.
customer_reviews.text: I got stuck on a sandy beach and these things just curled up and dug in like shovels. I only ventured out there because I had these in case I got stuck. Fortunately I have a small car and had a friendly passerby pull my small car out. Then I got to watch my niece dig these out of the sand. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: Tried them this past weekend in sand, pictured below. Got high centered on a log at the beach. Put them under the rear tires, coupled with my home made trax in the front, they worked just fine. The holes in it allowed it to suction into the sand which helped it not move.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, compact peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: They got me unstuck from along the highway in deep snow. The problem with them being yellow is that they are hard to see once they get buried in the snow while being used. I had to order another set to replace the one I couldn't find, but $16 is cheaper than a tow all day long. Now I have three traction pads for the next time I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Hazard

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Carry Insurance
customer_reviews.text: I have not used them yet and hope I dont have to, but they are always in the car just incase. They feel sturdy and have grippers on bottom as well as the tire side. they are wide enough to fit the average passenger tire are not flimsy so they should withstand the stress of a emergency situation in possibly adverse conditions. Plus they are not real expensive if it saves waiting for outside help and the possible cost of getting stuck. I think one person could get themselves out of a sloppy situation where otherwise they would struggle and only get themselves in deeper trouble. Cheap Insurance.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work for the Lawn Tractor
customer_reviews.text: I got the lawn tractor stuck and just needed to get the drive wheel to grip enough to back up a few inches. I first shoved the panel as far under the tire as I could and the tire just spun. Then I dug out under the tire so I could put the panel all the way under it and it still just spun. Maybe if I'd been heavier I could have put more weight over the tire and driven it down enough to catch on the plastic ridges.
customer_reviews.author: C. Scarpitti

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, holds up, lol easy to find if (live in Maine)
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy!! Bright color is easy to see after to find if it goes shooting off in a weird direction. Lolol some of my elderly neighbors shouldn't be driving!! "Keep your wheel straight and press gently on the gas" means "turn the wheel like on the tea cup ride at Disney and FLOOR THE GAS!!" Lolol but I find these anyways. May be in New York though we live in Maine, but hey they're YELLOW!!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Libby

customer_reviews.title: Bought these as a gift for my mail carrier...
customer_reviews.text: when they got stuck in my driveway but they weren't needed so I kept for myself figuring if my mail carrier got stuck anyone can. Well dang if I didn't get stuck on a dirt road after the snow melted. Looks were deceiving, tire tracks all over so figured it was safe, HA! Took 20 min. but I got out with the aid of these little suckers. Won't make that mistake again but these are staying in my car anyway!
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and easy to store in your trunk
customer_reviews.text: Used this product twice so far in Boston to move my 4 ton car. The pads worked to give traction but do show wear and leave some yellow plastic on the driveway. Will shoot out from behind the car if rear-wheel drive. Does the job and easy to store in your trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Robvargus

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I've used these twice so far to help out others getting their car unstuck in snow. These are obiously not heavy duty off road traction aids, but work well for the city and their size is convenient, they don't take up much space in the trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Pawel Tarnowski

customer_reviews.title: a great item and less expensive than in stores if you ...
customer_reviews.text: if you live in snow country get at least one to have for that time you are stuck. got me out of my icy driveway on to the main road. bought 2 so I wont worry com several winters. a great item and less expensive than in stores if you can find them.
customer_reviews.author: mongoose58

customer_reviews.title: Add to your Car Emergency Kit!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure we’d ever need these until we drove up on a couple stuck in some pretty thick mud. His truck was already in 4-wheel Drive and they had began trying to push it from behind. We slapped these bad boys down and BOOM they did just the trick. They never broke or cracked! Rinse them out and they’re good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Alexsis

customer_reviews.title: It seemed work just fine. However
customer_reviews.text: It seemed to be very durable. I tried to test it with my car once on the snow bank of my drive way. It seemed work just fine. However, a true test would be half of car stuck in the snow and, luckily that hadn't happened. Truthfully, I got them mostly for the peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle T.

customer_reviews.title: Subzero GripTrax
customer_reviews.text: I got stuck in the snow and was unable to move. The GripTrax got me out after repositioning them a couple of times.
customer_reviews.author: Iamgeandart

customer_reviews.title: Gets job done but ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as a gift for my sister who lives in Vermont. I was surprised that they were so ridged. My sister said they worked fine, but the second time one of them cracked. She called the company and they were sending her a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: ahbach

customer_reviews.title: Trust me these are the best
customer_reviews.text: I see idiots use cardboard haha seriously? These are the best, but if you live in heavy Winter land, get a 4 wheel or all wheel drive and a SUV. Silly people. I use these to get people out who get stuck in my street. Its fun to car count on how many gets stuck sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Joeking around

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set for my daughter at a store a couple of years ago and used them multiple times. In snow and mud. After a couple of years of use, they do start to get old and crack (just like everything else). Could not find them at a store, but found them on Amazon and we ordered a set for everyone in the family. Now everyone has a set in there vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: Take care

customer_reviews.title: If you live with snow, you need these in your trunk for emergencies
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't feel confident, driving in snow, without knowing these are in my trunk. We live in an area where getting a tow truck would be difficult. These are our insurance that if needed, we know we can get out of being stuck in the snow with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These should last a while.
customer_reviews.text: I've seen these sell for 2x as much, so I liked the price. I use them as a base for floor jack on softer ground and to keep the jack from rolling around. Off label use, but they work. No snow here in Florida
customer_reviews.author: Slugbug

customer_reviews.title: Good for light vehicles only.
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used the product yet but the built isn’t that great for heavy duty use. If you are an off-road enthusiast or just need something to last, buy the more expensive one. For the price, this should be okay for emergency use only. (I hope)
customer_reviews.author: RAC

customer_reviews.title: We really wanted them to work
customer_reviews.text: They got great reviews so we took a chance. Useless. We ended up having to call a tow/pull out. Wish we hadn't been confident and relied on these. We really wanted them to work out. Unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: WRS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing first try
customer_reviews.text: My neighbor’s car got stuck in snow while wheels spinning. I gladly offered my brand new SubZeros but they didn’t help at all. Quite disappointing. I’ll give them another chance before recycling those hard plastics.
customer_reviews.author: ThunderClaps

customer_reviews.title: Syracuse, NY weather approved!
customer_reviews.text: Love these, they are very thick plastic. Needed to use a few times as snow plow blocked us in and landlord doesn't plow. Good ol' shovel and these help me get out and on to work in time! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Col1775

customer_reviews.title: Possible life saving tool.
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this to everyone who drives in icy conditions or any slippery surfaces. It saved me when I was stuck in a ditch out in the country.
customer_reviews.author: BreAnna

customer_reviews.title: Very handy!
customer_reviews.text: I got a new SUV last winter and found that it wasn't as heavy and didn't have as high of ground clearance as my previous one. These little tools came in handy a few times. They are light and tuck nicely into a corner of the cargo area to be handy when needed!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie A

customer_reviews.title: Must have just in case
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven’t had to use these yet, they appear very sturdy and I think they will work perfectly for their intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Taz

customer_reviews.title: Meh!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these a couple of years ago. Ironically, after buying them, and toting them around in my trunk, haven't had a need for them. I can say, however, they tote around pretty good, and are still standing by if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Henthorn

customer_reviews.title: Haven't used myself. I bought them for my 4x4 ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used myself. I bought them for my 4x4 Ram that I use in sierra Nevada dirt roads that sometimes have some wide muddy ruts. I have seen them in action thou. Worked well for my buddys' Ford 150 4x4 short bed. That was enough to convince me. Just heed the precaution of not standing in the line of fire. BTW they held up to be reused.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: got me out of a bind! being that its ...
customer_reviews.text: got me out of a bind! being that its 70 degrees and march in PA i didnt think i would need it any more this year but man was i wrong! we have 3 cars and it worked beautifly to back out cars out from the thick layer of snow created by the snow plows. if it snows where u live get it!
customer_reviews.author: d mo 0101

customer_reviews.title: Great to have just in case!
customer_reviews.text: These are lightweight but very practical, especially driving on sand or mud. Seems they'd work great in snow, too.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not the best ones I've used but they work
customer_reviews.text: Used them during Harvy to get a lot of people unstuck. Definitely not the best ones I've used but they work
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: good dor 1 use
customer_reviews.text: value is so cheap even quality suffers. but it is good for 1 use. good for emergency use. not a repeat.
customer_reviews.author: Sweat igit

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I had the opportunity recently to help two men (I'm a woman, haha) get their cars unstuck in the snow in a parking lot. These things (along with the folding shovel I carry in my car) worked great!
customer_reviews.author: ceebee

customer_reviews.title: They do not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: These did not work to free a light, two wheel drive pickup that was in loose sand on a south Texas beach. We could never get the tires to get traction on the grips. I put more effort into digging a trench to place the grips than I did hooking up a tow strap.
customer_reviews.author: B. swainsoni

customer_reviews.title: The plastic was more slippery than the ice
customer_reviews.text: I tried using these to get out of 6 inches of snow that was 33 degrees so it was icing with pressure. Tried these and found them to be more slippery than the ice. My advice is get a good shovel and forget these.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Got me out of a deep mud puddle in my one-wheel-wonder
customer_reviews.text: With only one drive wheel spinning, and 4 in the mud, i was able to get out with these boards. You have to jam them under the wheels. Takes a little spinning to climb onto the board initially but they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: nice product for winter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a gift because I couldn't find it locally...product appears to be good quality and arrived on time.
customer_reviews.author: M. Booth

customer_reviews.title: Kind of cheap
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty small and cheap looking, haven't tried them yet but I would buy something better if I did it again.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Howell-Ulrick

customer_reviews.title: No Slip
customer_reviews.text: Looks durable and seems it will standup to some tire abuse.
customer_reviews.author: Lonely Planet

customer_reviews.title: I haven’t used them yet but it seems very cheap plastic and might break when you use them
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used them yet but it seems very cheap plastic and might break when you use them
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Wong

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a car in a ditch. It seemed like it was working. Until it flew from under tire and became a projectile. Luckily there were no tragedies or fatalities.
customer_reviews.author: Lykki LikeMe

customer_reviews.title: value
customer_reviews.text: seems substantial, hope I do not have to use it. the right price
customer_reviews.author: fisherperson

customer_reviews.title: Get some for your snow emergency--well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I got stuck in some deep snow and these worked fantastically to help me get the car out of the snow. I didn't think these would hold up because they are made of plastic but they did!
customer_reviews.author: C Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I put them in position. It must have been too icy, b/c they just shot out from under the tires without the car moving.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Tried them once in deep snow. Didn't really help. I would not buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: PickyGuy

customer_reviews.title: These are a good idea but I am afraid they just didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I occasion to need these in both snow and mud. Two separate attempts, two complete failures. These are a good idea but I am afraid they just didn't work. When I could get them under the tires, the tires still wanted to spin on these... But it's also *really* hard to get them under the tires.
customer_reviews.author: ValkRaider

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it will work
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to store. Haven't used it yet but looks like it will work.
customer_reviews.author: bangorfb

customer_reviews.title: Tried it once and it did not help me get going
customer_reviews.text: I only tried this one time. I was stuck on about 4 inches of show. I tried these and it nothing. Had to get pulled out.
customer_reviews.author: blueraygirl

customer_reviews.title: Nice size
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had to use yet, but product fits great in small trunk. Gives me some security traveling in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Lee

customer_reviews.title: I like them
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried it yet but it looks like it's okay
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Not sure yet.
customer_reviews.text: No snow yet so I'm not sure how sturdy it is.
customer_reviews.author: T  Bro

customer_reviews.title: looks good
customer_reviews.text: haven't had to use them yet, but they look well built for plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R Bogden

customer_reviews.title: Semi Truck approved.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a truck driver. Ordered 2 pair of these. They’ve got me unstuck in snowy parking areas twice now. One kicked under each drive tire does the job. Roll out to a better spot, stop, walk back and pick them up. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Howarth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used them yet. Expect they'll come in handy when needed. Got a pair for each car.
customer_reviews.author: D.B. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Unfortunately needed from time to time on our driveway at 8300 ft.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi

customer_reviews.title: Havent used them yet but they seem sturdy and look better than wet carpet samples thrown in ...
customer_reviews.text: Havent used them yet but they seem sturdy and look better than wet carpet samples thrown in the truck bed.
customer_reviews.author: Cs2CentReview

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These are well worth the money, I was questionable at first about how strong they were but they have helped me get 6 cars unstuck and the still going strong, I also used them to get a large van unstuck theses are great
customer_reviews.author: NY

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work in mud
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use to get a small SUV out of the mud. Didn't work at all. Maybe its better in snow but failed me when I needed it. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Got me unstuck !!
customer_reviews.text: Great for recovery, got me out when I had like 8 inches of snow. Make sure to put in front of the wheels that are stuck not behind lol. If it doesnt work shovel out snow and try diffrent wheels around the car untill you get out.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor living

customer_reviews.title: Worth having if you get stuck
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good value. Others have written that it doesn’t hold up well with use.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie // Super Mom

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and they work great. They store away easily when not in use
customer_reviews.text: A must have. Simple to use and they work great. They store away easily when not in use. So glad I got them!
customer_reviews.author: Dee L

customer_reviews.title: very small picture looks larger than they really are
customer_reviews.text: So small and the picture is deceiving. Get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Detrich

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: These did not work in the Montana snow this winter.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Works great in mud.
customer_reviews.text: Got stuck off roading in mud. Gave me the extra traction I needed to get out.
customer_reviews.author: Terence J. Mollick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the quality of this product. It seems better than I actually expected.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Well... I didn't get my money back, and I needed to pay for towing, and I lost it in the snow...so poor CS and lousy product bad purchase
customer_reviews.author: rom cohen

customer_reviews.title: He was pleased and they are actually in the back of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for my son-in-law whose mountain road is treacherous in winter. He was pleased and they are actually in the back of the truck!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got me out of a jam, last snow ❄️ storm ⛈
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE VEGA JR

customer_reviews.title: Easily broken. Meant for anything smaller than a Prius.
customer_reviews.text: Tiny. Anything over 3 inches of snow, these traction pads will disappear. Bite the bullet, spent the money on full sized ones.
customer_reviews.author: Anders

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size to store in the trunk!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gift for new drivers that drive in snow!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Nelko

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work very well on snow/ice
customer_reviews.text: Pretty useless in the snow. Attempted to use on a mixture of ice and snow while reversing a BMW X5 out of a driveway. The wheel caught the mat and flipped it out from under the car. In terms of design, one side would benefit from being fabric or something that digs into the snow/ice better. The other side clearly grips tires OK. I wouldn't bother buying this to use for snow/ice.... maybe it works better on mud or sand though.
customer_reviews.author: Dónal R

customer_reviews.title: good safety precaution
customer_reviews.text: these are just what we wanted in case we get stuck somewhere
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Works in soft mud
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a relative. I already had one, which successfully got both my wheels out of holes in summer mud and winter snow.
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: Not for deeper snow
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used these we had 3 lifted Subarus in about 2ft of snow on a small mountain trail. Each one of us got stuck in the same spot. These made no difference on the snow. One snapped in half right away and the other kept skipping out away from the tire. 3 stars because I think they made a difference but I'm not sure. I definitely won't use them again and will buy Maxx Trax next time.
customer_reviews.author: Matt L

customer_reviews.title: traction mat
customer_reviews.text: For the money they are very good. the plastic seems a little thin. I have another style that is very thick plastic, I don't know how these will hold up. but even if they only last for a few uses, it is worth the price. I have gotten out of a lot of situations that would have required a tow. or at least another vehicle to pull me out with a chain. The old pair has saved me many times. I'm sure these will work as well.If you live where there is snow or mud, I have both, these are a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Tomko

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, arrived fast and does exactly what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Come in Handy
customer_reviews.text: Work well very useful product ! Will be useful to help me out of a jam sometime in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: mbfan69

customer_reviews.title: Used them several times!
customer_reviews.text: We bought each of our 4 kids and their significant others a set of these to carry as part of their winter, emergency kids. We've all managed to use them and even share them over the winter. Great product, very useful and works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Gayla Baer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for digging out
customer_reviews.text: Got my car stuck in a ditch. Put them under the wheels and was out in no time. Very good.
customer_reviews.author: TLA

customer_reviews.title: Better then nothing but pack a shovel and some rock salt or kitty litter too .
customer_reviews.text: So so they spit out under the tires but better then nothing .

customer_reviews.title: These are a life saver, one week of buying ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a life saver , one week of buying I got stuck , and these saved me the cost of a wrecker.

customer_reviews.title: Item as described. I hope I don't have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Item as described. I hope I don't have to use them often however it reassuing to know if I need them they are in the car.
customer_reviews.author: RosePetalZZ

customer_reviews.title: Not good for stuck in deep snow
customer_reviews.text: I used multiple times and got myself out of spinning on little snow or ice

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product you never think you would need until you get stuck in a parking space.

customer_reviews.title: Winter essentials
customer_reviews.text: These are great and are winter essentials. They are strong and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: BM

customer_reviews.title: Bought for daughter who lives in Wyoming. They received ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for daughter who lives in Wyoming. They received 18" of snow so she was able to use them and she said they worked very well.

customer_reviews.title: snow shoes for tires
customer_reviews.text: for the money helps but in a real stuck situation only a tow does it.
customer_reviews.author: Ataturk

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Stuck in ice, these were of no use. Maybe helpful in mud.
customer_reviews.author: MountainNurse,BSNTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These saved me a couple of times this winter. Do work and think the price is right.

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than I expected which is great. Christmas present for our daughter up in Montana
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than I expected which is great. Christmas present for our daughter up in Montana.
customer_reviews.author: majahack

customer_reviews.title: but they appear sturdy and something to keep in the trunk of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had to use them yet, but they appear sturdy and something to keep in the trunk of the car in case of emergency.
customer_reviews.author: E Army

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: No snow yet but I am sure these will work out just fine
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: broke after first use
customer_reviews.text: i used these to get out my neighbor from our yard last night and they broke he didnt spin tires and it tore off grids to grip tire if u buy be very careful i would reccomend the portable tow truck or check out tracgrip.com they work awesome he hit icew and slid into 3 foot of snow front wheel drive and he got so stuck but they didnt work o ya and another good one is CAR UNSTUCK
customer_reviews.author: ryan Haines

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Phew, am I glad I purchased these! I have a 2009 Mazda 6 with brand new snow tires, and still managed to get stuck during the back-2-back blizzards of 2010. I used them 3x in the same night to get me out of sticky situations. I highly recommend these to anyone living in an area hit by snow (whether you get an inch at a time, or 2ft). For the price, you can't go wrong. I liked them so much, that I ordered another set for my other car. Believe me, you're floor mats will do nothing for you compared to these!
customer_reviews.author: M. Wenger

customer_reviews.title: Rigid and a bit short.
customer_reviews.text: Have not yet needed to use these. Upon inspection they appear a reasonable tool for the job, but my be too thick and rigid for numerous applications. They could also be longer.
customer_reviews.author: Wyatt D. Ribarich

customer_reviews.title: Spits it out
customer_reviews.text: My car parked on a driveway with 10 degree incline, 1.5 inches of new snow. Hopkins pads just got spit out as it went under the tire. Car move a in ch forward.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Hopkins Subzero 12501 Traction Mat
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly. Haven't been able to use yet (or, haven't NEEDED to, fortunately), but it seems to be good quality and gives peace of mind having it in the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: J.Y.

product_meta.title: SubZero 12501 GripTrax Traction Tool
product_meta.description: Style:SolidThe SubZero GripTrax Traction Tool is a must have emergency tool to get you through the winter season. Package includes two traction tools that is designed to get you out of those tricky situations in snow, mud and sand. For over forty years Hopkins Manufacturing and SubZero have shaped the winter snow and ice tools category.
feature_bullets: Place in front or behind tires for traction
Designed to hold in place, won't fly out
Works in snow, mud, and sand
2 traction tools included in each package
